ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I improved greatly in my understanding of spanish grammar and in how to have basic conversations in Spanish.
You will be able to have a decent conversation in Spanish after this class

This class refined my Spanish in a few weeks more than 4 years of high school Spanish could. Professor Tortora is absolutely amazing and such a wealth of knowledge. This class has inspired me to take more Spanish at Yale then just the required amount, and will definitely take me to L5!
I developed a greater knowledge of Spanish and the culture in Spanish speaking countries.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The greatest strength was Professor Tortura. The level of homework was a bit much though.
The textbook is too expensive and we dont spend enough time on grammar. Prof Tortora is amazing however.

The textbook is really expensive, and cannot be bought used because it needs the online code. The class is intense, but that is one of its strengths, as it forces you to learn Spanish. The weaknesses are dependent on the teacher. I loved my teacher, so I really enjoyed the class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would absolutely recommend this class to another student!
Yes, I would recommend it to any student that is taking Spanish at Yale.
